items.title: Darknet
items.description: One of the earliest use cases for cryptocurrency is use for buying of illicit items.

items.title: Crypto Funds
items.description: Instead of investing in single coins, crypto funds allow users to spread their risk by investing in a wide range of coins.

items.title: Decentralized exchanges
items.description: Decentralized exchanges do not rely on a third party service to hold the customer's funds, but allow for peer-to-peer transations.

items.title: DAICO
items.description:
Similar to an ICO, but here after crowdsale period ends, the contract will prohibit anyone from contributing any further and a tap variable that restricts withdrawals for the developers.

https://cointelegraph.com/explained/what-is-a-daico-explained

items.title: Bitcoin Futures
items.description:
Bitcoin Futures are an agreement to buy or sell an asset on a specific future date at a specific price. Either a long position, where you agree to buy an asset in the future at a specific price when the contract expires. Or when you take a short position, you agree to sell an asset at a set price when the contract expires.

Bitcoin Futures are listed on Chicago Board Options Exchange (CBOE).
